attributes.comment:
My adoption coordinator asked me to comment on the fee increase you are
proposing. She wants me to say that this is another step by the Government that
makes it HARDER to adopt a child, both domestically and abroad. However, part
of the proposal says that you will decrease the backlog. The most frustrating
part of our adoption so far is the wait time involved in getting our approval on
our fingerprints. If you reduce this backlog, then I don't care about the fee
increase.

I have talked with several people who have stated that their fingerprints were
lost several times and scheduling is a joke, sometimes a month out from when you
are sent the letter. In my experience, money doesn't fix incompetence, so if
you can get people processed in under a month and extend the expirations on
fingerprints, go for the fee increase. If not, you are just a bunch of
bureaucrats asking for more money.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Maurice G. Dion
